abstract: Goldman Sachs said Thursday that John Browne, who quit as chief executive of BP on May 1 after it emerged that he had lied during legal proceedings about how he met a former lover, had resigned from the Goldman board. Mr. Browne, who helped build the London-based BP into one of the largest oil companies in the world, had been a Goldman director since the investment bank went public in May 1999.
